intro: Gladiolus sulculatus, commonly known as the zigzag gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and showy, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. Its unique zigzag pattern on the leaves gives it its common name, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sunlight. Gladiolus sulculatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
